page.title: 16HISTORY:CARLTON and VILLAGES
page.content: {Wallingwells}is a little {hamlet. It was once a nunnery,before{Henry {VIII}tried to take it over,and {succeeded .}Wallingwells has had many owners through the years. Wallingwells had many{prioresses} the most famous one was{Margaret {Dourant.}She was dug up in{1829}by the Victorians. Today{Wallingwells House} is a{residential home.Wallingwells {House}is now surounded by trees.There are only two other houses left in Wallingwells. The oldest building in {Letwell}is the{Dovecote}it was built approximatley in 18th {century but now it's being repaired.{Carlton has still a{water mill.}The people who wrote the first{Domesday book mentioned it in{1086}that means,it's about{899,years}old, but some people have added bits on to it.
